t: Isaiah 28
Woe to Ephraim and Jerusalem
Woe*pn to the crown of pride, to the drunkards of Ephraim, Whose*ld glorious beauty is*i a fading flower Which*ld is*i at the head of the verdant valleys, To*ld those who are overcome with wine!

Behold,*ld the Lord has a mighty and strong one, Like*ld a tempest of hail and a destroying storm, Like*ld a flood of mighty waters overflowing, Who*ld will bring them*i down to the earth with His*i hand.
The*ld crown of pride, the drunkards of Ephraim, Will*ld be trampled underfoot;

And*ld the glorious beauty is a fading flower Which*ld is*i at the head of the verdant valley, Like*ld the first fruit before the summer, Which*ld an observer sees; He*ld eats it up while it is still in his hand.
In*ln that day the Lord*s of hosts will be For*ld a crown of glory and a diadem of beauty To*ld the remnant of His people,
For*ld a spirit of justice to him who sits in judgment, And*ld for strength to those who turn back the battle at the gate.

But*ln they also have erred through wine, And*ld through intoxicating drink are out of the way; The*ld priest and the prophet have erred through intoxicating drink, They*ld are swallowed up by wine, They*ld are out of the way through intoxicating drink; They*ld err in vision, they stumble in*i judgment.
For*ld all tables are full of vomit and*i filth; No*ld place is*i clean.*i
“Whom*ln will he teach knowledge? And*ld whom will he make to understand the message? Those*ld just*i weaned from milk? Those*ld just*i drawn from the breasts?
For*ld precept must*i be*i upon precept, precept upon precept, Line*ld upon line, line upon line, Here*ld a little, there a little.”
For*ln with stammering lips and another tongue He*ld will speak to this people,
To*ld whom He said, “This is*i the rest with*i which*i You*ld may cause the weary to rest,” And,*ld “This is*i the refreshing”; Yet*ld they would not hear.

But*ld the word of the Lord*s was to them, “Precept*ld upon precept, precept upon precept, Line*ld upon line, line upon line, Here*ld a little, there a little,” That*ld they might go and fall backward, and be broken And*ld snared and caught.
Therefore*ln hear the word of the Lord,*s you scornful men, Who*ld rule this people who are*i in Jerusalem,

Because*ld you have said, “We have made a covenant with death, And*ld with Sheol we are in agreement. When*ld the overflowing scourge passes through, It*ld will not come to us, For*ld we have made lies our refuge, And*ld under falsehood we have hidden ourselves.”
A Cornerstone in Zion
Therefore*p thus says the Lord God:*s “Behold,*pn I lay in Zion a stone for a foundation, A*ld tried stone, a precious cornerstone, a sure foundation; Whoever*ld believes will not act hastily.
Also*ld I will make justice the measuring line, And*ld righteousness the plummet; The*ld hail will sweep away the refuge of lies, And*ld the waters will overflow the hiding place.
Your*ld covenant with death will be annulled, And*ld your agreement with Sheol will not stand; When*ld the overflowing scourge passes through, Then*ld you will be trampled down by it.
As*ld often as it goes out it will take you; For*ld morning by morning it will pass over, And*ld by day and by night; It*ld will be a terror just to understand the report.”
For*ln the bed is too short to stretch out on,*i And*ld the covering so narrow that one cannot wrap himself in*i it.*i
For*ld the Lord*s will rise up as at*i Mount Perazim, He*ld will be angry as in the Valley of Gibeon— That*ld He may do His work, His awesome work, And*ld bring to pass His act, His unusual act.
Now*ld therefore, do not be mockers, Lest*ld your bonds be made strong; For*ld I have heard from the Lord God*s of hosts, A*ld destruction determined even upon the whole earth.
Listen to the Teaching of God
Give*pn ear and hear my voice, Listen*ld and hear my speech.
Does*ld the plowman keep plowing all day to sow? Does*ld he keep turning his soil and breaking the clods?
When*ld he has leveled its surface, Does*ld he not sow the black cummin And*ld scatter the cummin, Plant*ld the wheat in rows, The*ld barley in the appointed place, And*ld the spelt in its place?
For*ld He instructs him in right judgment, His*ld God teaches him.
For*ld the black cummin is not threshed with a threshing sledge, Nor*ld is a cartwheel rolled over the cummin; But*ld the black cummin is beaten out with a stick, And*ld the cummin with a rod.
Bread*ld flour*i must be ground; Therefore*ld he does not thresh it forever, Break*ld it*i with*i his cartwheel, Or*ld crush it with*i his horsemen.
This*ld also comes from the Lord*s of hosts, Who*ild is wonderful in counsel and*i excellent in guidance.
